name: Digital Residues I - The Guardian
description: Luminescent blobs, small creature-like particles that breath and expand, discarded, compost-bodies inhabiting a liminal space and floating just above the understory of a fairy forest.  These particles are the unpredictable result of a low-resolution process of photogrammetry, a method that renders 3D models by overlapping photographs of objects. Foraging through the marginal residues of the softwareâ€™s digital processes, Mora dissected the digital landscapes. Wherever glitches surfaces, she meticulously isolated them, enlarged them, and brought them to life, creating a multitude of microorganisms-looking glitches that inhabit a similarly photogrammed landscape.
